News.Title: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Board Meet Feb 13
News.Summary: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Limited has scheduled a board meeting for February 13, 2026, to consider Q3FY26 unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: Cerebra Gets E-Auction Notice from Canara Bank
News.Summary: Cerebra Integrated Technologies receives e-auction sale notice under SARFAESI Act from secured lender Canara Bank on January 23, 2026, following earlier demand notice from July 2025.

News.Title: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Receives Legal Notice from Secured Creditor Canara Bank
News.Summary: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Limited disclosed that Canara Bank, one of its secured creditors, has served a notice at two company premises in Bengaluru and Kolar. The notice was served at the company's Peenya Industrial Area location in Bengaluru and its KIADB Industrial Area facility in Kolar. The company stated it has initiated necessary actions to address the notice. The disclosure was made in compliance with materiality requirements for listed companies.

News.Title: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Reports Rs 1,410 Crore Loss in Q1 FY26, Faces Going Concern Issues
News.Summary: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Limited reported a net loss of Rs 1,410.13 crore for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025, compared to a loss of Rs 1,063.51 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations declined to Rs 179.05 crore from Rs 1,017.27 crore year-on-year. The company recorded exceptional items including stock devaluation of Rs 954.79 crore. The Board approved the appointment of Mr. Parameshwar Bhat as Secretarial Auditor for five years and recommended re-appointment of YCRJ & Associates as Statutory Auditors. Auditors issued a disclaimer of conclusion citing going concern uncertainties, noting the company has incurred significant operating losses, reduced workforce, ceased refurbishment activities, and faces challenges meeting obligations including Rs 23 crore in defaulted loans. The company operates in E-Waste Recycling & Refurbishment segment and temporarily shut down refurbishment activity due to lack of working capital.

News.Title: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Corrects Director Designation for Jignesh J. Mehta
News.Summary: Cerebra Integrated Technologies Limited corrected the designation of Mr. Jignesh J. Mehta's appointment as Additional Director. The Board approved his appointment on July 9, 2025, as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director for a 5-year term, subject to shareholder approval. The company clarified that his designation was incorrectly mentioned as Independent Director in previous communication. Mr. Mehta brings over 30 years of experience in strategy, financial management, and capital markets, currently serving as a key leader at Leo Dry Fruits & Spices Trading Limited. He holds a Commerce degree from the University of Mumbai and is not related to other directors.
